subject: Productivity
title: The Shrinking Attention Span
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Shrinking Attention Span.

hook.text: In 2004, office workers focused on a task for three minutes on average. By 2023, it dropped to 47 seconds.

buildup.text: Gloria Mark tracked attention spans for over two decades. The decline was steady and alarming.

discovery.text: The cause isn't brain damage. It's environmental: more interruptions, more screens, more notifications.

twist.text: Shorter attention spans aren't permanent. Remove the distractions and focus rebounds quickly.

climax.text: The crisis isn't inside our heads. It's in our environments. Redesign the space, restore the focus.

punchline.text: Your attention didn't shrink. Your distractions multiplied.

quiz.question: What did Gloria Mark's research find about attention spans in 2023?
options: Workers focused for an average of 47 seconds
Workers focused for over ten minutes
